meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny - Let's get this review started!

I'm thrilled to dive into Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 1 + 2, the remastered gem that has brought back so many fond memories for old-school gamers like me. But before we get too sentimental, let's focus on the gameplay, shall we?

The first thing I noticed was how effortlessly smooth the controls are. It's like riding a skateboard (which I've never actually done, but I imagine it's similar). The game's mechanics have aged surprisingly well, and the addition of modern features like improved graphics and online multiplayer only enhances the experience.

Now, I know what you're thinking: "But [Your Name], what about all those other reviewers saying the same thing?" Well, let me tell you, my friends - I'm not just echoing their sentiments; I'm bringing my own brand of zany humor and critique to the table!

Take IGN's reviewer, for instance. They called Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 1 + 2 a "tremendous turnaround" from its predecessor, and I couldn't agree more. The game is a love letter to the original PlayStation era classics, with lovingly designed levels that will transport you back to the good ol' days of skate culture.

GameSpot also praised the game's accessibility and satisfying combos, which makes it easy to jump back in with a new character. And let's not forget Game Informer's glowing review, which called Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 1 + 2 "a blast from the past that feels fresh and current."

Now, I know some of you might be thinking, "But what about the downsides?" Ah, yes, my friends - even the most perfect remasters have their flaws. Like, for instance, those pesky load times that can slow down your skating experience. But honestly, it's a small price to pay for all the goodness Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 1 + 2 has to offer.

So there you have it, folks! A review that's equal parts fun and functional. If you're looking for a game that will transport you back to the golden age of gaming, look no further than Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 1 + 2.

Final thoughts: Don't bother trying to calculate my score - just know that I loved this game!
